Aiming is bad\, but all ND games have so so weapon aiming\, enemy A.I. is woefully unbalanced - you can either kill someone a few feet away from an enemy without being spotted\, or an enemy can spot you hiding under a car 50ft away and mayhem ensues....Voice acting is good and music is a continuation of the first game.But for a game that has been in development so long the changes made to game play are minimal - especially when you consider it's also a jump from Ps3 to Ps4....The story is just wave after wave of 'guilt killings' and angst ridden dialogue that is desperately trying to be radical and daring but is just a chore to listen too and watch - the washed out colours and the overall oppressive mood make you long for a moment that lifts the mood.Characters are not very likeable or relatable and after a while it's clear that ND are more interested in this as an interactive movie about social and sexual political views rather than an actual video game.I understand the desire to make it very cinematic as it is linking to a HBO tv show\, but player input is mostly reduced to a viewer...The writing has made the amateur mistake of making the game characters fit into a narrative rather than the characters dictate the narrative\, forcing a main character to be shockingly 'out of character' most of the time...It is also way too long and could have been trimmed down several hours and may have benefited for it.If you enjoy movie style games\, like a smattering of limited stealth\, and can endue a story that made me reach for anti depressants and a bottle of vodka then you will find something to enjoy....Me?
